intro: Potentilla impolita subsp. dissecta, commonly known as the dissected cinquefoil, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It is characterized by its finely divided, fern-like leaves that give it a delicate appearance. The plant produces clusters of small, yellowish-white flowers during the summer months. It prefers well-drained soils and full sun to partial shade, often growing in alpine or rocky environments. Its botanical features make it a distinctive and ornamental species within the Rosaceae family.
